title: What is the significance of animal magnetism and hypnotherapy in medical history and literature?
first_phrase: In this text, we explore the concept of animal magnetism and hypnosis through various perspectives and historical references. The text references many names, such as Braid, Heidehain, Bleuler, Munterberg, Berad, Lafontaine, Dalla Pizia, Elman, Castaneda, and Wolinsky. The last 200 tokens discuss the absence of amnesia in hypnosis and its requirements, as well as "Trance People Live."
content: Ad un certo punto Don Juan gli dice che l’ha “scelto” attraverso lo sguardo dell’occhio sinistro. L’occhio sinistro è quello che è collegato all’emisfero sinistro ed irrazionale. [159] Non è così nella letteratura ipnotica del secolo scorso. Alcuni autori addirittura affermavano (tra questi anche Braid – cfr. “Neuripnology”, il che conferma la nostra teoria della concentrazione dell’attenzione come prerequisito per lo stato) che se non vi era amnesia non vi era ipnosi. [160] Cfr. “Trance People live” Wolinsky
last_phrase: In conclusion, the power of hypnosis lies in the concentration of attention required to induce a trance-state. As Don Juan chose his apprentice through his left eye, connected to the irrational hemisphere, hypnosis too requires an amnesic state to truly work, as believed by some authors. For more information on this topic, refer to Wolinsky's "Trance People Live."
